page.title: 02ROKEBY HALL
page.content: There has been a manor house near the confluence of the rivers Tees and Greta for centuries. The present one was built in 1735 and has served as the family home of the Morritt family, who own the surrounding estate, almost all of that time. Times and life-styles change. The house is far too large for a modern family and its maintenance too costly. With the aid of a grant from the Historic Buildings Fund, essential work is being undertaken. In return the house will be open to the public from 1986. Thus the house will again be alive. It will be part family home, part showcase of an age that is past, but from time to time it will be filled with people and provide employment for guides and others as it did in the past.
